abstract: Merrill Lynch will pay $160 million to settle a racial bias lawsuit. | Two regulators are preparing enforcement actions and fines against JPMorgan Chase. | An effort to increase disclosure on executive pay may have created more murkiness.
snippet: Merrill Lynch will pay $160 million to settle a racial bias lawsuit. | Two regulators are preparing enforcement actions and fines against JPMorgan Chase. | An effort to increase disclosure on executive pay may have created more murkiness.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch has agreed to pay $160 million to settle a racial bias lawsuit that wound through the federal courts for eight years, Patrick McGeehan reports in DealBook. The payout in the suit, which was filed on behalf of 700 black brokers who worked for Merrill, would be the largest amount ever distributed to plaintiffs in a racial discrimination suit against an American employer, Mr. McGeehan writes. Merrill, which is now owned by Bank of America, also agreed to take advice from black employees on how to improve their chances of success as brokers.

headline.main: A Record Payout in Bias Case
